page.title: 14ILFORD PARK POLISH HOME.
page.content: In 1947 the Polish Resettlement Act was launched for the Polish fighters and their families and relatives. In the war the site was an American hospital.There were alot of Polish pilots that fought for England. After the war was over the fighters couldn't go back to Poland so the British set up Polish homes like{Ilford Park.}Some of the Polish people came indirectly from Poland, travelling first to Africa or Italy, refugees from their own country. Last Friday we went to Ilford Park. Now it is like a home for old people but they still speak Polish. We went into one old lady's room, it was not very big and she didn't have very many belongings. There are special baths for disabled people, one of the baths had a door on it. In the blocks were little kitchens so if they didn't like what was to eat
